If you really want to make a difference in cybersecurity – make it with us!Ready for an exciting challenge? We are looking for an experienced Cybersecurity Consultant who wants to revolutionize the market with his/her expertise and passion for security. At our company, we pride ourselves on having a strong expertise in factories and making it available to our customers. If you are ready to conquer the world of Cybersecurity and play a significant role in securing industrial processes, apply now!In a nutshell:As Industrial Consultant Cybersecurity you guide our customers into improving their cybersecurity posture in industrial and critical infrastructure environments. By positioning the global portfolio of Siemens in OT (Operational Technology) cybersecurity, we protect Siemens and our customers around the world. In your role as cybersecurity Consultant, you will face different stakeholder interests where you need to manage expectations by constantly translating technical concepts and expert topics into business language to assure management buy-in for accelerated progress in your projects.This is your challenge:You will be driving delivery of cybersecurity consulting services, e.g., gap and risk assessments, development of mitigation plans and tailored cybersecurity roadmaps.As part of a community of 1300+ cybersecurity experts you will collaborate and deliver comprehensive cybersecurity projects.Additionally, you will contribute to the development of the cybersecurity portfolio by providing input regarding customer demands, market trends, and evolutions of cybersecurity regulations.What we are looking for:A master’s degree in cybersecurity, computer science, data science or similar fields as well as first relevant work experience. Alternatively, you have an excellent bachelor’s degree in above majors combined with several years’ relevant work experience in similar capacity.A first consulting experience from industrial environment is required, while solid cybersecurity knowledge is advantageous for this role.Ideally you are familiar with leading cybersecurity standards (e.g., IEC 62443, ISO 27001, NIST CSF).You possess knowledge of industrial control systems (ICS) / Operational Technology (OT).Knowledge of cybersecurity controls and technologies (e.g., hardening, IDS, vulnerability management, anomaly detection, network segmentation) is beneficial.Cybersecurity certifications (e.g, IEC 62443, CISSP, GICSP, CISA) are appreciated; willingness to learn and get certified along your growth journey is a prerequisite.You have outstanding analytical and communication skills and a high level of passion, social competence, and team spirit. Your willingness (around 10%) to travel to customer sites in Europe.You bring with excellent communication skills.What We Offer.Hybrid working concept in an international environmentDevelopment opportunities for both personal and professional growAn environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work and feel a sense of belongingBroal range of wellbeing offeringsShare matching program to become a shareholder of Siemens AGMake your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.Siemens is committed to equal opportunities for women and men, as well as diversity as a source of creativity and innovation. Having different types of talent and experiences makes us more competitive and better prepared to successfully respond to the demands of our society. We value candidates who reflect the Diversity we enjoy in our Company.

Descripción de la empresaDevoteam es una consultora líder en Europa centrada en estrategia digital, plataformas tecnológicas, ciberseguridad y transformación empresarial a través de la tecnología.La tecnología está en nuestro ADN y creemos en ella como una palanca capaz de impulsar el cambio a mejor, manteniendo un equilibrio que nos permite ofrecer a nuestra cartera de clientes herramientas tecnológicas de primer nivel pero siempre con la cercanía y profesionalidad de un equipo que actúa como guía en el camino.Devoteam lleva más de 25 años apostando por la tecnología al servicio de las personas. Con más de 10.000 personas en el grupo, en 20 países de Europa, Oriente Medio y África.  Descripción del empleoDesde Devoteam G Cloud buscamos varios Ingenieros de Datos enfocados a GCP para importantes proyectos que tenemos dentro de la compañia, la posición es 100% desde España. Responsabilidades:Colaborar con los clientes para comprender sus necesidades y desafíos de datos, traduciéndolos en soluciones técnicas en GCP.Diseñar, construir e implementar pipelines de datos eficientes y escalables utilizando servicios como Dataflow, Dataproc, Cloud Functions y Composer.Desarrollar e implementar procesos ETL/ELT para integrar datos de diversas fuentes, incluyendo bases de datos, archivos y APIs.Trabajar con grandes conjuntos de datos utilizando tecnologías como BigQuery, Cloud Storage y Dataproc.Implementar y mantener la calidad de los datos y el cumplimiento de las normativas de seguridad.Optimizar el rendimiento y el coste de las soluciones de datos en GCP.Automatizar tareas y procesos utilizando herramientas de orquestación y scripting.Documentar las soluciones implementadas y proporcionar soporte técnico a los clientes.Mantenerse al día con las últimas tecnologías y mejores prácticas de GCP.Contribuir al crecimiento del equipo compartiendo conocimientos y participando en iniciativas de desarrollo.  RequisitosRequisitos:Experiencia comprobada en ingeniería de datos.Sólido conocimiento de los servicios de GCP, como BigQuery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub y Composer.Experiencia en el diseño e implementación de pipelines de datos utilizando herramientas como Apache Beam y Airflow.Dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python y SQL.Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.Pasión por la tecnología y el aprendizaje continuo.Certificaciones de Google Cloud (deseable).

titulo_oferta: Principal Data & AI Architect - Field CDO EGM
descripcion: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategorySalesJob DetailsAbout SalesforceWe’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.Principal Data & AI Architect - Field CDO EGMJob DetailsAt Salesforce, we're seeking an outstanding individual to support the EMEA Growth Market (CEE/CIS, MEDITERRANEAN, ISRAEL, AFRICA) territory as Data & AI Architect - Field CDOSalesforce Agentforce and Data Cloud, our flagship innovations, harnesses the power of real-time data analytics and AI to redefine Customer 360, enabling scalable, high impact customer interactions.As a part of our Solution Engineering team, you will play a pivotal role in crafting customer engagement and delivering ground-breaking results! We are looking for individuals with deep Data and AI knowledge and strong experience in selling complex technology solutions, understanding cloud-based services, and designing B2B solutions. Collaborating with potential clients, you will dive deep into understanding their needs and challenges ultimately showcasing how Agentforce, Data Cloud are the answers for their most critical business goals.The Data & AI Architect / Field CDO is a customer-facing enterprise-wide authority with broad and deep awareness around the data, analytics and AI domains, paired with a good eye for business and partner engagement skills.The Data & AI Architect / Field CDO is an authority in categories that may include business strategy, AI, data, analytics, cloud and enterprise architecture. Field CDOs are encouraged to have strong sales and technical skills and use validated consultative approaches to engage with customers and motivate them for their transformation journey, along with defining the steps to get there.This role will have a strong customer-facing element with an emphasis on establishing strong partnerships with our most strategic customers and helping them implement a data analytics strategy that drives values for everyone.Responsibilities:Promote the value of Data & AI and the impact a data-led transformation can have on our customers’ business and their customers’ experience.Contribute to the customer's business planning and strategy by focusing on business capabilities and maturity. Understand customer needs, company's products/services and match them with outstanding technology to define a north-star target state. Help to define prioritization and sequencing of the transformation by proposing a strategic roadmap that leads to the target state. Lead key discussions about change programs.Resolve Salesforce (primarily focus on Agentforce and Data Cloud) and third-party technologies to leverage in the customer's architecture landscape, based upon product knowledge, industry experience and frameworks.Clearly articulate business architecture (mission/vision, capability models, capability assessments) and technical architecture (current and future state diagrams, solution standard processes, reference architectures, design patterns) to an executive audience.Share reliable and trusted -data rich- points of view of relatable customer transformations in the industry i.e. how other customers with similar needs have succeeded in their transformation.Help build our business through effectively engaging with account executives and solution engineers to develop opportunities for customer-facing enterprise analytics engagements.Participate in all appropriate product/sales training, certifications, educational sessions and industry summits to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position.Share engagement experience with the internal audiences and enrich collective IP. Conduct enablement sessions to mentor and guide other architects and solution engineers.Required Experiences And Qualifications:Proven success in either Data, AI, Enterprise Architecture fields over a period of 8+ years.Experience in delivering Data & AI solutions based on data-led transformations that demonstrate value and tackle meaningful business challenges.Deep understanding of Data Architecture, Data Governance and Analytics topics.Deep understanding of AI and machine learning concepts, understanding of the agent platform, how to configure and set up agents, hook them into existing flows, automation, api connection, etc.Strong technical selling skills including the ability to explain Data Architecture, AI models and solutions to non-technical clients and how Data + AI capabilities and solutions can translate to business.Deep appreciation of the CDO role and ability to nurture influential relationships with C-level executives.Credible knowledge around common enterprise architect topics such as persona based journeys, process orchestration, master data management, analytics and insights etc.Keen appreciation of Enterprise and Cloud Architecture and the principles of modern platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, multi-tiered infrastructure, networking, security principles, etc.Proven grasp of Salesforce platform capabilities, or similar data and analytics platforms.Outstanding Communication And Negotiation Skills Honed Through Your Experience.A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience with extensive background in technology sales.Fluency in English.Ability to travel up to 40–50%, as required to meet business needs.Advantageous/Preferred Experiences And Qualifications:Chief Data Office or Chief Data Scientist experience.Proven ability to craft and communicate data and AI strategies that align with business objectives.Deep knowledge on Salesforce Data, AI and Analytics technologies.Knowledge of analytics platforms like AWS S3, DataBricks, Google Big Query, Snowflake Microsoft Fabric.Knowledge of AI/Generative-AI solutions from vendors like AWS, Google, Microsoft.Proficiency in cloud platforms (e.g., Salesforce, AWS, GCP, Azure) and advanced data modeling techniques.A deep understanding of data security, compliance, and privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).About SalesforceWe’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.AccommodationsIf you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com.Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.Salesforce welcomes all.

titulo_oferta: NHT/CCR Process Optimization Engineer - Relocate to Saudi Arabia, Permanent Expat Family Relocation Package
descripcion: Please note that this role is based in Saudi Arabia on a permanent, residential basis.Job Req ID:15348Aramco energizes the world economy.Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco’s value to society.Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.OverviewWe’re seeking NHT/CCR Process Optimization Engineer to join our Global Manufacturing Excellence (GME) organization under the Downstream Operation Engineering Solutions Department (OESD) and drive performance improvements for our facilities.OESD’s technical team is a multidisciplinary team that provides the necessary high-quality technical support to GM operating facilities (refineries, Natural Gas Liquids facilities, and petrochemical plants) within the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and across the globe.You will identify optimization opportunities, develop data-driven recommendations, and guide facilities toward maximum impact.Key ResponsibilitiesAs the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:Conduct comprehensive technical assessments of facilities’ NHT and CCR units, focusing on identifying areas for optimization in yield, efficiency, and product quality.Translate insights into actionable recommendations, supported by detailed cost-benefit analyses and clear implementation roadmaps.Collaborate closely with facilities’ process engineering teams, providing technical guidance for troubleshooting, problem-solving, and continuous optimization.Lead technical benchmarking initiatives, comparing facilities’ performance against industry best practices to identify improvement gaps and provide recommendations.Develop and deliver targeted technical training programs on NHT/CCR technologies, best practices, and optimization strategies.Guide facilities in selecting and implementing advanced process simulation tools and optimization techniques specific to NHT and CCR units.Provide expert technical advice on catalyst management strategies, including performance monitoring, selection, and replacement, based on hands-on experience.Stay up-to-date with the latest technical advancements, best practices, and technologies in NHT/CCR process optimization, sharing this knowledge with facilities to enhance their operations.Minimum RequirementsAs the successful candidate you will hold a:Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, preferably Master's degree or Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a focus on process optimization.15 years of experience in process engineering, with at least 10 years of hands-on technical experience in NHT and CCR optimization within a refinery environment, and at least 5 years in a technical role focused on process improvement.Professional Engineering (PE) license is preferred.You will be able to demonstrate strong technical background in process engineering fundamentals, including reaction kinetics, thermodynamics, and mass and energy balances, as applied to NHT and CCR units.Proficiency in leading process simulation software (e.g., Aspen HYSYS, PRO/II) and their application in NHT and CCR process modeling and optimization.You will have demonstrated technical experience in successfully applying process optimization techniques, statistical data analysis, and advanced process control (APC) to drive measurable improvements in NHT and CCR units.You will have experience with real-time optimization (RTO) techniques specifically applied to NHT and CCR units.You will have in-depth technical knowledge of catalyst management and performance optimization strategies, gained through hands-on experience in NHT and CCR units.Familiarity with Industry 4.0 technologies, such as IoT, machine learning, and data analytics, and their application in optimizing NHT and CCR processes.Working environmentOur high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world’s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs – one of the largest in the world.

AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software. Our cutting-edge solutions are used by thousands of enterprises to deliver the essentials of life – such as energy, infrastructure, chemicals and minerals – safely, efficiently and more sustainably.We’re the first software business in the world to have our sustainability targets validated by the SBTi, and we’ve been recognized for the transparency and ambition of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We’ve also recently been named as one of the world’s most innovative companies.If you’re a curious and collaborative person who wants to make a big impact through technology, then we want to hear from you! Find out more at AVEVA Careers.For more information about our privacy policy and how to manage cookies, visit our Privacy Policy.The jobWe are looking for a Data Scientist to play a pivotal role in solving complex business problems and discovering business insights using quantitative disciplines (statistical, algorithmic, and mining) and visualization techniques. The role involves planning, executing, and delivering machine learning-based projects, contributing to building and developing the organization’s data science models, and supporting the organization with insights and analysis for decision-making processes.ResponsibilitiesUse advanced data science techniques and approaches to solve specific business problems, exploring a variety of techniques to identify the optimal solution.Prioritize, scope, and manage data science projects and the corresponding key performance indicators (KPIs) for success.Identify AI/ML business opportunities and collaborate across the business to understand IT and business constraints.Build predictive models, Machine Learning algorithms and experiments by writing optimized code and using state-of-the art ML technologies.Integrate domain knowledge into the ML solution, such as understanding financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, and marketing.Collaborate with ML operations (MLOps), data engineers, and IT to evaluate and implement ML deployment options.Bring new technology and approaches into production.Adhere to and promote to best practices and standards for data science process (including documentation) and code developments.Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver AI-based and ML data science products.Evangelize and discover opportunities for the use of large language models (LLMs) within the organization.Remain up to date with industry practices and emerging technologies such as generative AI and test creative ways of offering AI solutions.Support the organization with insights and analysis for decision-making processes.Skills and qualifications:1-3 years of demonstrated experience in data science or related field.Solid mastery of programming fundamentals, algorithms and data structures.Expertise with core data science languages (predominantly with Python) and experience working with database systems (such as SQL, NoSQL).Demonstrated application of Data Science techniques in supervised and unsupervised learning contexts.Technical understanding of the key algorithms such as Linear Regressions, Random Forests, SVM, KNN, K-means, etc.Proven experience in developing and deploying Machine Learning (ML) models with measurable business impact.Past involvement in AI-based projects, especially with experience in advanced prompt engineering and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).Familiarity with Azure infrastructure, particularly Azure ML Studio and Azure Databricks.Knowledge of Azure’s Prompt Flow as a developmental tool is a plus.Knowledge of git/version control systems.Experience with search engines, classification algorithms or recommendation systems is a plus.Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.IT at AVEVAOur global team of 300+ IT professionals is responsible for the systems and platforms that keep AVEVA running. By empowering our colleagues and ensuring the smooth operation of the company, we help keep the business healthy and productivity high. We also provide key support for the transformation and modernisation efforts globally.We pride ourselves on a collaborative, inclusive and authentic culture that provides a framework allowing for autonomy, whilst always being available for support and guidance. We respect the differences that each team member brings and seek to include those perspectives in our solutions for our business functions. The energy and sense of purpose is evident when talking to team members, you will feel part of something special from the first day you join.AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

titulo_oferta: Data Scientist (Mid and Senior) - Fraud and Risk Evaluation
descripcion: Hello! We're Teya.Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.We’re here because we don’t believe there’s a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.We’re here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don’t think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.We’re here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.Become a part of our story.We’re looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.Your MissionYou will be part of a joint team of machine learning engineers and data scientists building and evolving ML models, real-time systems, reports, and deep analysis of fraud detection and mitigation activities to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from illicit activities.Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants.In This Role, You’ll BeHelping Teya to use data to drive business decisionsWorking on projects including but not limited to fraud detection, transaction monitoring, customer onboarding risk, cost-to-serve and cost-to-acquire modellingBuilding predictive models to a production level adopting coding best practicesWorking closely with other data scientists and machine learning engineers to support the analytical part of the machine learning lifecycleYour StoryBackground in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning,, Statistics, Economics or equivalent)3+ years of professional working experienceSomeone who thrives in developing innovative, state-of-the-art products that can meet and surpass the latest advances in the fieldProficiency in, Amazon SageMaker, SQL, Jupyter NotebookExperience with Machine Learning and statistical inference.Understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines and ability to work closely with Machine Learning Engineers for product implementationAbility to communicate outcomes of a data analysis to business stakeholdersStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to think creatively and insightfully about business problemsNice to have:Proficiency in Snowflake.The PerksCompetitive salary;Health Insurance;25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);Office snacks every day;Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment;Flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team.

DEIMOS is looking for an engineer to join the Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision (AICV) Competence Centre of the Avionics Business Unit, within the Flight Systems Directorate.This role focuses on supporting Deimos’ AICV flight systems team in researching, developing, deploying, and scaling our Machine Learning and Computer Vision portfolio for onboard processing applications in Space. You will work on in-space Machine Learning projects and products throughout their lifecycle – from early-phase R&D activities to productization and deployment.Location:Selected candidates will have the option to work in any of the following Deimos sites they are legally entitled to work in.Harwell (UK)Madrid (Spain)Lisbon (Portugal)Bucharest (Romania) Duties:The main responsibilities are:Research, design, implement, and deploy Machine Learning algorithms that address specific challenges and opportunities related to onboard processing in Space.Collaborate with team members and clients across Europe to understand project requirements, objectives, and constraints.Integrate and collaborate closely with other Computer Vision and Machine Learning engineers for Agile algorithm and product development.Process and analyze datasets to extract meaningful insights and features.Design, implement, and maintain industry-standard infrastructure for new and existing Machine Learning products.Optimize and standardize ML training and validation processes, data warehousing and pipelinesEducation:Bachelor’s, Master's, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Machine Learning, Data Science, Physics, or a related fields.Professional Experience:The position will be tailored to the level of experience; practical industry experience deploying and maintaining ML systems in production would be viewed very positively.Technical Requirements:Required:Strong foundation in machine learning algorithms, statistics, and data structures within relevant technical projects.Proficiency in programming languages and frameworks such as Python, C++, MATLAB, OpenCV, TensorFlow, Pytorch, scikit-image, and dlib.Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.Knowledge of software development life cycle and agile methodologies.A basic understanding of Machine Learning.Highly Desirable:Understanding of Computer Vision techniques.Experience working on aerospace-related projects.Experience deploying MLOps solutions and working within CI/CD frameworksExperience with Linux systems and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, etc.)Experience developing embedded ML applications (C++, CUDA, TensorRT)Language Skills:Good level of English, spoken and written.Ability to speak Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, or Romanian will be considered an assetAbility to speak any other language will also be considered a positivePersonal Skills:Capability to integrate in and work within a trans-European teamSolid organisational, analytical and reporting skillsAutonomy and willingness to take initiativeExcellent communication skillsEnergetic, positive team player mentalityDon’t miss this opportunity! If you meet the requirements and are ready to take on new challenges, apply now with the English version of your resume and become part of our team at Deimos.Ref.: HRRECRUIT-1003

¿Te imaginas participando en la transformación de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.Buscamos a una persona con un perfil de Junior para incorporarse a nuestro equipo de Technology & Transformation – Cyber, que quiera desarrollarse en áreas clave como Extended Enterprise.Nuestros servicios abordan los desafíos complejos que enfrentan las organizaciones al interactuar y colaborar con terceros (proveedores, partners, etc.). Nuestro equipo está especializado en el diseño, despliegue, revisión y mantenimiento de marcos de control que aseguran la seguridad, la continuidad y la eficacia operativa, tanto desde enfoques tradicionales como mediante la adopción de nuevas tendencias tecnológicas como Inteligencia Artificial, Machine Learning, Data Science, etc.Disponemos de un amplio equipo de perfiles multidisciplinarios con un gran equilibrio de conocimiento técnico y entendimiento del negocio, garantizando soluciones integrales y adaptadas a las necesidades de nuestros clientes. ¿Cómo será tu día a día?  Ayudarás en la identificación, evaluación y mitigación de riesgos asociados con proveedores y partners externos, asegurando que las relaciones de terceros cumplan con los estándares de la compañía.  Darás asesoramiento en los requisitos funcionales y técnicos para una herramienta de TPRM y/o CLM.  Darás soporte en la implementación y despliegue de herramienta de TPRM y/o CLM.  Participarás en la evaluación y fortalecimiento de la cadena de suministro de nuestros clientes, diseñando estrategias que garanticen su capacidad para anticiparse a posibles interrupciones.  Participarás en la gestión integral del ciclo de vida de los contratos, asegurando que los acuerdos sean respetados y que los riesgos contractuales estén controlados a lo largo de todas las etapas.  Realizarás revisiones sobre marcos de controles específicos, asegurando que las relaciones con terceros cumplen los estándares de la compañía.  Participarás en la adopción de nuevas tecnologías (IA, ML, Data Science) y/o herramientas tecnológicas de nicho.  ¿Cómo te imaginamos?  Que seas graduado en ingeniería o matemáticas  Que tengas alto nivel de inglés, muchos de nuestros clientes son internacionales.  Que tengas fuerte capacidad analítica, atención al detalle, y una disposición proactiva para aprender y adaptarse en un entorno dinámico.  No necesitamos que tengas experiencia previa, sí motivación y muchas ganas de aprender.  ¿Cómo es trabajar en Deloitte? 🤩 Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendrás un largo recorrido y aprendizaje☯️ Un día a día híbrido-flexible: tendrás horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes⚽ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutarás de varios teambuildings al año, actividades culturales y deportivas… ¡y mucho más!🧘♀️ Bienestar integral: cuídate con nuestro programa de salud física, mental y financiera… ¡y con equipo médico en las oficinas!🤲 Impacto social: Podrás apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes más lo necesitan🗣️ Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecerás en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formación impulsarán tu desarrollo. ¿Ya te visualizas en la Deloitte University de París?🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:  Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil  Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor ¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

About MoonPay 🌖💸Hi, we’re MoonPay. We’re here to onboard the world to Web3.Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratizing technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.What we doWe’re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products — just take a look on Trustpilot.We’re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.But that’s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It’s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.So whatever your background, we’re sure there’s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.Locations Supported 🌍Portugal, Spain, Poland, Romania, South Africa, UKAbout The Opportunity ✍️We're on the lookout for a skilled Product Data Scientist to join our team, where you'll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximising our product performance. This is your chance to have a significant impact on our market-leading products, optimising identity initiatives and delivering actionable insights across the wider product organisation. Join us and be part of an exciting journey to reshape our industry!What you will do…Provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on a deep understanding of MoonPay products, and be able to identify and drive new opportunities for product improvements & enhanced customer experiencesWork closely with the Identity team and business stakeholders within the compliance team to review product performance, look for opportunities to optimise our products, and deliver data driven strategies for increased product performance.Define KPIs, design tracking and set up monitoring for new product launches & changes.Oversee and implement A/B tests and other experiments to drive forward optimization effortsLeverage and incorporate forecasting or predictive modelling techniques to drive recommendations / actionable insights.Build robust data models downstream of backend services and external data sources.Design, build and scale both internal and external data products, which drive informed decision making; examples include dashboards, reports, models, algorithms, integrations into other product lines.Communicate complex concepts and findings to technical and non-technical audiences across different teams, including VPs, while ensuring clarity and understanding to drive critical business decisions.As a Product Data Scientist you will be expected to:Independently lead projects from end-to-end.Prioritise and manage competing tasks and deadlines effectively, aligning with goals and adapting to changing priorities.Contribute to our overall approach and standards within the data discipline.Be proactive in spearheading initiatives to support stakeholders and business partners around the organisation. About You 🙋You will be expected to be able to lead data projects from end-to-end, as well as support junior analysts on the team. You will be someone who can contribute to our overall approach and standards within the data discipline. You will be proactive in spearheading initiatives to support stakeholders and business partners around the organisation.What you will need…Advanced SQL, data modelling, and data visualisation tools are second nature to you.You have a deep understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and probability, including experience in conducting large-scale A/B tests.You have experience working with product teams in an analytics role and are interested in working in the identity/compliance domain.You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment.You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and C-level executives.2-5+ years experience as a data scientist or data analyst.Bonus Points If You HaveWorked with DBT, Google BigQuery, Looker and PythonExperience working in fintechExperience working in start-ups or scale-upsKnowledge of cryptocurrencyResearch has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. titulo_oferta: Beca para estudiantes de máster - Análisis de datos
descripcion: ¿Quieres lanzar tu carrera en el entorno del dato de la mano de una entidad especialista en nuestro sector?Buscamos estudiantes universitarios, preferiblemente de máster, interesados en adquirir experiencia formativa en un entorno profesional dinámico y retador. Durante las prácticas, tendrás la oportunidad de colaborar en varios de nuestros equipos de Data Management, Business Intelligence y Data Analytics, para conocer más de cerca cómo es trabajar en este campo.Te invitamos a participar en nuestro programa de prácticas, donde podrás vivir una experiencia formativa a través de varios departamentos de tu área de interés. Descubre cómo se aplican tus estudios en un entorno real y desarrolla habilidades clave para tu carrera.¿Cuáles serían algunas de las tareas en las que podrías llevar a cabo?Como parte de tu formación, podrás participar en diversas actividades relacionadas con la gestión, análisis y visualización de datos como por ejemplo:Recopilación, limpieza y estructuración de datos provenientes de distintas fuentes.Implementación de procesos para garantizar la calidad, consistencia y gobernanza de los datos.Diseño y mantenimiento de bases de datos y modelos de almacenamiento de información.Desarrollo de dashboards interactivos y reportes en herramientas como Power BI, Tableau o QlikView. Análisis de KPIs para apoyar en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.Análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos (Big Data) para identificar patrones, tendencias y oportunidades de negocio.Uso de herramientas analíticas y lenguajes de programación como Python, R, SQL o .Net para procesar y analizar datos.Desarrollo de modelos predictivos y de machine learning para optimizar procesos internos y mejorar la experiencia del cliente.¿Qué requisitos buscamos?Para participar en esta oportunidad de prácticas, buscamos estudiantes que cumplan con los siguientes requisitos:Imprescindible posibilidad de realizar prácticas por un periodo mínimo de 6 meses mediante convenio con universidad.Estar cursando estudios universitarios de máster en Ingeniería Informática, Ciencia de Datos, Estadística, Matemáticas, o áreas relacionadas.Familiaridad con lenguajes de programación como Python, R, SQL o .Net.Conocimientos básicos en herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Tableau o similares.Deseable experiencia con bases de datos (relacionales y no relacionales) y Big Data.Nivel alto de inglés (mínimo B2); se valorará positivamente un nivel avanzado.¿Qué ofrecemos?📌 Experiencia que combina aprendizaje, impacto y desarrollo profesional.📌 Modalidad de prácticas mixta compaginando presencialidad y en remoto 💻 para ponértelo más fácil.📌 Ayuda económica al estudio 💸.📌 Un lugar en donde nos importan las personas, por eso nos hemos certificado como GPTW por cuarto año consecutivo. 💚📌 Acceso a tu espacio de aprendizaje personalizado 👩🎓, con recursos y contenido para desarrollar tu talento.

Título: Data Engineer / Data ScientistUbicación: MadridSalario: 35,000 EUR Modalidad: Híbrido en MadridResumen del puesto:El Data Engineer / Data Scientist será una pieza clave en la transformación digital de la empresa, encargándose de la arquitectura, manipulación y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos. Su objetivo principal será convertir estos datos en información procesable que apoye la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Este rol colaborará estrechamente con equipos de IT y negocio para diseñar modelos predictivos y optimizar los procesos de análisis de datos.Responsabilidades:Diseño y desarrollo de pipelines de datos: Crear y mantener pipelines de datos robustos que aseguren la integridad, calidad y accesibilidad de los datos para su análisis.Modelos predictivos y machine learning: Construir y optimizar modelos predictivos y algoritmos de machine learning que proporcionen insights avanzados y mejoras en los procesos de negocio.Colaboración interdisciplinaria: Trabajar con analistas de datos y equipos de negocio para identificar necesidades de información y proponer soluciones analíticas efectivas.Gestión de bases de datos: Administrar y mejorar bases de datos y almacenes de datos (data warehouses) en la nube, integrando diversas fuentes de datos para una mejor accesibilidad y análisis.Visualización de datos: Crear dashboards e informes que ofrezcan una visión clara y accionable de los datos para los equipos de negocio, facilitando la toma de decisiones informadas.Requisitos:Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años de experiencia como Data Engineer o Data Scientist.Dominio de herramientas y lenguajes de programación de análisis de datos como: Python, SQL y R.Experiencia en arquitecturas de datos y manejo de pipelines (ETL) y data warehouses.Conocimientos avanzados en machine learning y técnicas de visualización de datos.Experiencia en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards interactivos.Formación académica: Título en Ciencias de la Computación, Estadística, Ingeniería de Datos o un campo relacionado.Beneficios adicionales:Modalidad híbrida: Disfruta de la flexibilidad de trabajar dos días a la semana desde casa.Desarrollo profesional: Oportunidades de formación continua y desarrollo profesional dentro de la empresa.Ambiente de trabajo: Únete a un equipo dinámico y colaborativo, comprometido con la innovación y la excelencia.Cómo aplicar:Si estás interesado en esta oportunidad, por favor aplica a través de esta oferta o envía tu CV a selene.martinez@hays.es¡Estamos deseando conocerte! 😊

¡Conócenos!Somos HOYA LENS IBERIA, filial española-portuguesa de HOYA Vision Care, empresa multinacional japonesa dedicada al desarrollo, fabricación y comercialización de lentes oftálmicas y servicios de valor diferenciado en el campo del cuidado de la visión, contribuyendo de esta forma a la mejora de la salud y calidad de vida.Acompañamos y apoyamos a Profesionales de la Visión desde hace más de 75 años, viendo el mundo a través de sus ojos.¿Qué estamos buscando?Buscamos figura de Ingeniería Junior, con pasión por la mejora continua y la optimización de procesos para integrarse a nuestro equipo de Operaciones. Este rol tiene como objetivo identificar, liderar e implementar proyectos de mejora en diversas áreas, aplicando herramientas Lean, análisis de datos y metodologías avanzadas para generar impacto tangible en la eficiencia, calidad y rentabilidad de nuestras operaciones.¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?Identificación y análisis de oportunidades de mejora.Gestión de proyectos de mejora.Análisis de datos y toma de decisiones.Colaboración interdisciplinaria.Seguimiento de KPIs.Además, sumarás puntos si cuentas con habilidades analíticas sólidas, dominio en el manejo de datos y herramientas tecnológicas, así como un enfoque práctico y colaborativo para trabajar con equipos multifuncionales.¿Qué necesitamos de ti?Grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Organización, de Procesos o carreras afines.Experiencia hasta máximo 2 años en roles similares o prácticas relacionadas con mejora de procesos, análisis de datos o áreas operativas.Nivel avanzado de Microsoft Excel (tablas dinámicas, macros, análisis de datos).Inglés hablado y escrito para interactuar con equipos globales.Además, valoraremos muy positivamente si cuentas con:Estudios o certificaciones adicionales en Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma o Data Science.Conocimientos sólidos en herramientas Lean (Kaizen, VSM, 5S, etc.)Experiencia trabajando con bases de datos (SQL, Access, etc.).Conocimientos en herramientas de Data Science (Python, R, Power BI, Tableau) es un must!¿Qué ofrecemos?En HOYA apostamos por el talento y capital humano. Ofrecemos una contratación indefinida y un salario con proyección, oportunidades de desarrollo profesional en un entorno dinámico y de aprendizaje constante. Además de exposición a proyectos estratégicos en diversas áreas operativas y beneficios atractivos con un entorno de trabajo colaborativo.Si te interesa un nuevo proyecto y consideras que eres el perfil ¡hablamos!¿Te apetece?En Hoya Lens Iberia apostamos por crear un entorno de trabajo en el que se promueva la igualdad de trato y oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, por ello compartimos nuestro compromiso en el establecimiento y desarrollo de políticas que integren la igualdad entre mujeres y hombres, sin discriminar directa o indirectamente por razón de sexo, así como en el impulso y fomento de medidas para conseguir la igualdad real en el seno de nuestra organización, estableciendo la igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres como un principio estratégico de nuestra Política Corporativa y de Personas.

AdemásCarrera profesional FormaciónBuen ambiente laboralRetribución flexibleTeletrabajo: híbridoHorario flexible ¿Quieres conocer más? ¡Ínscribete!Requisitos mínimosRequisitos MínimosImprescindible experiencia en Python, Pyspark y SQL para manipulación de datos. (Se realizarán pruebas)Experiencia trabajando con AWS con enfoque en procesamiento de datos, análisis y automatizaciones al menos de 2 añosExperiencia en la creación de métricas y KPI utilizando herramientas de BI para generar informes (Quicksight, Microstrategy, DOMO o similar) al menos de 2 añosExperiencia trabajando con sistemas de control de versiones como Git al menos 2 añosNivel avanzado de inglés.

Unison is a telecom and renewables infrastructure investment firm funded in partnership with Ardian - the global investment house based in Paris with over $150 billion in assets under management. Unison commenced operations in 2003 and today invests in real estate and infrastructure hosting wireless and renewables tenants in the United States and Europe. The Company is expanding rapidly and looking for talented, entrepreneurial team members to grow with us.The Unison team is looking for an energetic, detail-oriented Data Researcher that can help support our business.THE JOB:Accurate collection of data from various sources and entry in CRM systemData to day administration tasks including data entryMonitoring of progress to ensure meeting of daily, weekly, and monthly goalsSupport the team with answering data queries and updating records as requiredPerforming other appropriate duties as required by Unison Site Management to facilitate the changing demandsREQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: A degree in a relevant discipline would be great but not essentialPERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:The successful candidate will bring a high level of ethical, intellectual, professional, and personal values that complement the team and company culture, including:Detail conscious, concerned for accuracyIntermediate working knowledge of excelExcellent communication and collaboration skillsAbility to organize own workload and achieve deadlinesComfortable working alone as well as part of a teamDemonstratable professional approach and positive attitude, with strong problem-solving skillsAbility to effectively balance speaking in Spanish, French and in EnglishOTHER DETAILS:This will be an hourly contracted positionWork hours are flexible, with some mandatory overlap with U.S. business hours for team conference calls.Interested candidates should send a brief cover letter and one-page resume to Sandra Kelly at skelly@unisonsite.com

NTT DATA is the 6th largest IT services company globally, with over 100,000 professionals and a revenue exceeding 15 billion euros. We focus on exceeding client expectations, managing projects proactively, and fostering growth through quality and talent. Our ambitious goal is to secure a position among the top 3 IT service providers worldwide, and for 4 consecutive years, we’ve been recognized as one of the best places to work in Spain.We are expanding our Area of Expertise in Artificial Intelligence (AoEIA) and seeking a Generative AI Engineer with a specialization in Large Language Models (LLMs) to work on exciting projects for top-tier clients across Europe.What Are We Looking For?We are seeking a Generative AI Engineer to drive the technical design, integration, and deployment of LLM-based solutions. As part of our Data & Intelligence CoE, you will work on building and optimizing LLMs, integrating them into scalable platforms, and creating AI-driven use cases that solve real-world business challenges.Your expertise will focus on:Designing and implementing SLM/LLM models (such as GPT, Gemini, or Llama) for various applications, including natural language understanding, text generation, summarization, and more.Building and integrating LLM-based platforms that deliver AI services in cloud-native, hybrid, or on-prem environments, tailored to client needs.Developing CI/CD pipelines specifically for LLM deployment and monitoring, ensuring continuous improvement and scalability of AI systems.Collaborating with data scientists and engineers to create flexible and robust LLM use cases for diverse industries, including customer support automation, knowledge management, content generation, and more.Overcoming challenges related to scaling LLM models, optimizing performance for inference, and ensuring efficient resource utilization in production environments.Establishing best practices for managing SLM/LLM fine-tuning and customization, ensuring high-quality model outputs that align with business objectives.What Will You Be Accountable For?As a Generative AI Engineer focusing on LLMs, your key responsibilities will include:Project Execution: Ensuring successful delivery of LLM-based solutions, developing the necesary pieces of code.Platform Development: Automating LLM platform management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and deploying LLMs in large-scale environments.CI/CD and MLOps Integration: Developing pipelines for LLMs that streamline the lifecycle from training and fine-tuning to deployment and performance monitoring.LLM Customization: Building custom solutions to integrate LLMs with external systems, leveraging APIs, middleware, and bespoke development to meet client requirements.Innovation: Staying at the forefront of generative AI technologies, particularly LLM advancements, and bringing cutting-edge solutions to our clients.Why Would We Want to Meet You?We’d love to meet you if:You have 2+ years of experience working with AI projects, specifically involving large language models (GPT, BERT, etc.).You have hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).You are proficient in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub Actions) and have built pipelines that support AI/ML workflows, especially for LLMs.You have strong programming skills in languages like Python, with a focus on using machine learning frameworks like Transformers, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.You have experience deploying LLM models in production, ensuring they meet the specific needs of client use cases.You have worked on AI-driven projects in a startup, large enterprise, or research environment and have experience operationalizing LLMs for real-world applications.We Value Experience In:Developing LLM use cases, such as conversational agents, document summarization, content generation, and more.Implementing MLOps pipelines specifically for the LLM lifecycle, including data preprocessing, inference, and monitoring.Optimizing large models for efficient inference in production environments.Experience with model monitoring, retrieval strategies, and feedback loops to continuously improve model performance.What Do We Offer?At NTT DATA, we offer:The opportunity to work on high-priority LLM projects for leading companies in Spain and Europe.Direct visibility to senior leadership and involvement in transformative AI initiatives.The chance to apply the latest innovations in large language models and generative AI on platforms like AWS.The opportunity to attend and present at AI conferences.A competitive salary aligned with your experience.A personalized career development path with continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and training in AI, cloud technologies, and leadership.Interested?If you’re ready to shape the future of generative AI with us, apply today!

Do you want to build a better future?About Enfinity GlobalEnfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own renewable energy assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.Our team of over 250 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.Job description:We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Business Development Analyst Trainee to join our dynamic team in the renewable energy sector. The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting business operations, analyzing market trends, and contributing to strategic decision-making processes. This position is an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or professionals with up to one year of experience to build their careers in a fast-growing and impactful industry.This opportunity has a project management component and candidates will be analyzing a portfolio of more than 70 Projects in Europe, working simultaneously in cooperation with other members of the teams based in Spain and Italy. Key responsibilities:Conduct market research and data analysis to support strategic initiatives in the renewable energy sector.Develop, maintain, and optimize reports and dashboards to provide insights into key business metrics.Utilize Business Intelligence (BI) tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or similar) to create data visualizations and support decision-making.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver actionable insights.Assist in the preparation of business reports, presentations, and performance dashboards.Support the evaluation of new business opportunities and partnerships.Monitor industry trends and provide recommendations to enhance business performance.Ensure effective communication and coordination between stakeholders.Qualifications:Engineering degree in civil, mechanical, or electrical (preferable). Data science or related field is also valid.0-1 year of experience in business analysis, project management, reporting, or a related role (internship experience is a plus).Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Proficiency in Italian and Spanish is a significant advantage.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (advanced level preferred).Desirable experience with Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or similar).Basic knowledge of SQL or other data querying languages is a plus.Basic experience in Geographic Information software: ArcGIS, QGIS or ArcViewStrong analytical and problem-solving skills. Attention to detail and a proactive mindsetAbility to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Adaptability and eagerness to learn.Willingness to travel up to 50%.Passion for renewable energy and sustainability.In Enfinity Global group you will find a very dynamic and multinational environment in one of the most exciting and impactful industries. Here we will foster your professional and personal growth, and you will have the opportunity to actively contribute and make a real impact on climate change.Let’s build our future together.Visit www.enfinity.global to discover more about our culture and values.
